alert.note: Alert for Uintah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 3:42PM MDT until May 30 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Green River near Jensen affecting Uintah County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Green River near Jensen. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, minor lowland flooding is expected along the Green River, impacting agricultural land, irrigation and a few out buildings near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The Green River will oscillate near bankfull through Friday morning, before water levels begin to rise into the weekend. A maximum value of 9.6 feet is expected early Sunday afternoon. Then, the river is forecast to decrease below bankfull Monday night into Tuesday. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.8 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
